holidays.name: Umbrella Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the trusty umbrella, your best friend against rain, shine, or even unexpected snow showers! Get out your coolest, quirkiest umbrella and dance in the drizzle.
holidays.origin: Originally popularized by an American umbrella company in the mid-20th century to boost umbrella sales during slow months.
holidays.funFact: The earliest umbrella was designed over 4,000 years ago in ancient Egypt, initially to provide shade from the sun rather than rain!

holidays.name: Have a Brown Day
holidays.description: Embrace all things brown today‚Äîwear brown clothing, eat chocolate, coffee, or baked goods, and appreciate the understated elegance of the color brown.
holidays.origin: Created by someone who realized brown rarely gets its own special day, encouraging people to celebrate this warm, comforting color.
holidays.funFact: Despite being a common color, brown is rarely chosen as a favorite color‚Äîyet it's vital in nature from soil to chocolate!

holidays.name: Don't Cry Over Spilled Milk Day
holidays.description: An unofficial day reminding everyone not to waste energy worrying about small mistakes or misfortunes‚Äîlike spilling milk! Clean up, laugh it off, and move on.
holidays.origin: Inspired by the age-old saying encouraging resilience and optimism during minor setbacks.
holidays.funFact: The phrase 'Don't cry over spilled milk' dates back to at least the 17th century, promoting practical positivity.

holidays.name: Clean Out Your Computer Day
holidays.description: A quirky tech holiday encouraging digital spring cleaning. Delete old files, organize folders, and maybe even delete some embarrassing selfies.
holidays.origin: Started by a tech company to promote computer maintenance and reduce digital clutter.
holidays.funFact: Cleaning your computer‚Äôs hard drive can actually speed up its performance and free up valuable space!
